item.text: Supplemental report filed by the Committee on the Judiciary, H. Rept. 115-797, Part II.
Supplemental report filed by the Committee on the Judiciary, H. Rept. 115-797, Part II.

PERMISSION TO FILE SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT - Mr. Goodlatte asked unanimous consent that the Committee on the Judiciary be authorized to file a supplemental report on H.Res. 928. Agreed to without objection.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 162.
Reported adversely (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 115-797.
Reported adversely (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 115-797.
Ordered to be Reported Unfavorably (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 13 - 12.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption
Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

summary.text:
Requests the President and directs the Attorney General to transmit to the House of Representatives copies of any document, record, audio recording, memorandum, correspondence, or other communication in their possession, or any portion of any such communication, that refers or relates to:

  • any pardon issued by the President on or after January 20, 2017;
  • any pardon under consideration, including for Michael Cohen, Paul Manafort, Richard Gates, Michael Flynn, George Papadopoulos, or Alex van der Zwaan;
  • any consideration of the President's power to pardon himself; and
  • the President's decision to issue pardons without first consulting the Office of the Pardon Attorney of the Department of Justice.

Requests the President and directs the Attorney General to transmit to the House of Representatives copies of any document, record, audio recording, memorandum, correspondence, or other communication in their possession, or any portion of any such communication, that refers or relates to:

  • any pardon issued by the President on or after January 20, 2017;
  • any pardon under consideration, including for Michael Cohen, Paul Manafort, Richard Gates, Michael Flynn, George Papadopoulos, or Alex van der Zwaan;
  • any consideration of the President's power to pardon himself; and
  • the President's decision to issue pardons without first consulting the Office of the Pardon Attorney of the Department of Justice.

bill.title: Of inquiry requesting the President and directing the Attorney General to transmit, respectively, certain documents to the House of Representatives relating to the President's use of the pardon power under article II, section 2 of the Constitution.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
